org.jcvi.jillion.fasta

Interface FastaDataStore<S,T extends Sequence<S>,F extends FastaRecord<S,T>,D extends DataStore<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of object in the sequence encoding.
    T - the type of Sequence of in the fasta.
    F - the type of FastaRecord in the datastore.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, DataStore<F>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    NucleotideFastaDataStore, NucleotideFastaFileDataStore, PositionFastaDataStore, ProteinFastaDataStore, ProteinFastaFileDataStore, QualityFastaDataStore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLargeFastaFileDataStore, AdaptedFastaDataStore, AdaptedNucleotideFastaDataStore, IndexedProteinFastaFileDataStore.Impl, IndexedQualityFastaFileDataStore.Impl, LargeProteinFastaFileDataStore, LargeQualityFastaFileDataStore

    public interface FastaDataStore<S,T extends Sequence<S>,F extends FastaRecord<S,T>,D extends DataStore<T>>
extends DataStore<F>
    FastaDataStore is a marker interface for a DataStore for FastaRecords.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getSequence

        default T getSequence(String id)
               throws DataStoreException
        Get the just full Sequence of the given record.
        API Note:
        The default implementation is just 
         F record = get(id);
 if(record ==null){
     return null;
 }
 return record.getSequence();
        But different implementations may override to use more efficient techniques.
        Parameters:
        id - the Id of the record to get; can not be null.
        Returns:
        the Sequence for that ID if it exists; or null if the ID does not exist.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem getting the sequence.
        Since:
        5.1

      • getSubSequence

        default T getSubSequence(String id,
                         long startOffset)
                  throws DataStoreException
        Get just the part of the Sequence of the given record starting from the given start offset (0-based) until the end of the sequence.
        Parameters:
        id - the Id of the record to get; can not be null.
        startOffset - the start Offset to use
        Returns:
        the Sequence for that ID if it exists; or null if the ID does not exist.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem getting the sequence.
        IllegalArgumentException - if startOffset is negative or beyond the sequence length of this sequence.
        Since:
        5.1

      • getSubSequence

        default T getSubSequence(String id,
                         Range includeRange)
                  throws DataStoreException
        Get just the part of the Sequence of the given record that intersects the given Range. If the Range is beyond the entire sequence, an empty sequence should be returned.
        Parameters:
        id - the Id of the record to get; can not be null.
        includeRange - the subSequence Range to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        the Sequence for that ID if it exists; or null if the ID does not exist.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem getting the sequence.
        Since:
        5.1

      • asSequenceDataStore

        D asSequenceDataStore()
        Return a new DataStore is a "view" of just the Sequences from this datastore. This Fasta DataStore is the backing datastore so all calls to the returned Sequence Datastore will delegate to this fasta datastore and then get adapted to return just the sequence. When this fasta datastore closes, the returned datastore will also close and vice versa. Closing this datastore will close the other as well.
        Returns:
        A new DataStore instance which is a linked view of this Fasta DataStore but adapted so that all the records will just be the sequences.
        Since:
        5.3
